converpriv: Conversion and Dependent Conversion requirement is $2,000
portability: Portability is not available in Alaska
facilitypaymentlimitat: Facility of Payment requirement is $4,000 and $3,000 for a minor
claimsprovis: Fiduciary language has been removed from the Claims Provisions page.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-9095-0711): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the Alaska Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its  purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

converpriv:
If the dollar amount in item B. (2) is an amount other than $10,000, then said dollar amount is changed to $10,000.  

If in the Conversion of Dependent Life Insurance provision dollar amount in item B. (2) is an amount other than $10,000, then said dollar amount is changed to $10,000.
requirednotices:
Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8709-1203): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief  explanation of the Arkansas Life and Disability Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

Information Notice (LRS-8446-1198): This form is attached to the Policy and Certificate. It provides the name, address and telephone number of the soliciting agent; the name, address and telephone number of the field office providing service to the Participating Unit; and the address and telephone number of  the Arkansas Insurance Department.

Complaint Notice (LRS-8630-1215):  This notice must be attached to the policy and certificate(s).  It provides information on how the policyholder/insured can make an inquiry to the Company or file a complaint with the Department.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8670-1216):  This form must be attached to the certificate(s). It    explains the general functions of the California Life and Health Guaranty Association Act.
Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8710-0701):  This form must be attached to the certificate.  It explains the purposes of limitations of the Colorado Life & Health Insurance Guaranty Association.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8767-0616): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the District of Columbia Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

portability:
1. Removed the Portability option when a group terminates its Participating Unit agreement

2. Made clear  that if the insured is disabled under the Waiver of Premium provision, he/she may not use the Portability option

3.  Give reliance the option to either limit how long the insured can continue coverage under the Portability option or provide an limited time frame

4.  Discontinue permitting individuals to add supplemental benefits when enrolling through the Portability option

5.  Make it clear that the premium rate to be charged will be based on the experience of individuals who have continued coverage though the Portability option.

4.  Discontinue permitting individuals to add supplemental benefits when enrolling through the Portability option

requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8721-1092):  The 'Notice Concerning Coverage Limitations and Exclusions Under the Hawaii Life and Disability Insurance Guaranty Association Act' must be attached to the certificate.

genprovis: Misstatement of Age and/or Smoking Status is replaced with the following: Misstatement of Age-If an Insured’s or any insured Dependent’s age is misstated, the premium will be adjusted if necessary.  If the Insured’s or any insured Dependent’s coverage is affected by the misstated age, it will also be adjusted.  The insurance coverage will be changed to the amount the Insured or any insured Dependent is entitled to at his correct age.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-9400-1116): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides brief notice of the existence of the Indiana Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act and that there are limitations and exclusions regarding coverage thereunder.

Information Notice (LRS-8610-1116): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides RSL’s name, address and telephone number and the address and telephone numbers of the Indiana Department of Insurance.

brief explanation of the Iowa Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

masterapp: Maine requires the following fraud notice on the Master Application above the signature line: 'It is a crime to knowingly provide false, incomplete or misleading information to an insurance company for the purpose of defrauding the company.  Penalties may include imprisonment, fines or a denial of insurance benefits.'
genprovis:
The INCONTESTABILITY provision has been revised to read as follows:

Any statement made in your application will be deemed a representation, not a warranty.  We cannot contest this Policy after it has been in force for two (2) years from the date of issue, except for non-payment of premium.

Any statements made by you, any Insured or any insured Dependent, or on behalf of any Insured or any insured Dependent, to persuade us to provide coverage, will be deemed a representation, not a warranty. This provision limits our use of these statements in contesting the amount of life insurance for which an Insured and any insured Dependent is covered. The Following rules apply to each statement.

A. No statement will be used in a contest unless:
1. It is in written form signed by the Insured or any insured Dependent, or on behalf of the Insured or any insured Dependent; and
2. A copy of such written statement is or has been furnished to the Insured, insured Dependent, or the Insured’s or any insured Dependent’s beneficiary or legal representative.
B. If the statement relates to an Insured’s or any insured Dependent’s insurability, it will not be used to contest the validity of insurance with respect to which such statement was made after such insurance has been in force prior to the contest for two (2) years during such person’s lifetime.

This provision does not preclude the assertion at any time of defenses based upon provisions in this Policy that relate to eligibility for coverage.
converpriv: The minimum conversion amount is $10,000 (not $5,000) is insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy.
facilitypaymentlimitat: When there is no named Beneficiary or the named Beneficiary is not surviving at the insured’s death, we may pay up to $2,000 (not $2,500) to a person who has incurred expenses in connection with the insured’s last illness, death or burial.
depinsurance: In the CONVERSION OF DEPENDENT LIFE INSURANCE section, the minimum conversion amount is $10,000 (not $5,000) if insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy.

facepage: Maryland requires the following statement on the Certificate face page: The Policy providing your coverage may omit some of the benefits required for a policy issued and delivered in Maryland.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8900-0222): The Notice of Protection Provided by Maryland Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Corporation must be attached to the policy and the certificate.

facepage: RSL’s address (Philadelphia address) appears within the masthead on both the Group Policy and Certificate.
genprovis:
Incontestability provisions is replaced with the following: Any statements made in your application or the Participating Unit Application will be deemed a representation, not a warranty.  We cannot contest this Policy or a Participating Unit’s insurance after it has been in force during the lifetime of the Insured or any insured Dependent, for two (2) years from the date of issue, except for on-payment of premium.

Any statements made by you, the Participating Unit, any Insured or any insured Dependent, or on behalf of any Insured or any insured Dependent, to persuade us to provide coverage, will be deemed a representation, not a warranty.  This provision limits our use of these statements in contesting the amount of life insurance for which an Insured and any insured Dependent is covered.  The following rules apply to each statement.

A. No statement will be used in a contest unless:

1) it is in written form signed by the Insured or any insured Dependent, or on behalf of the Insured or any insured Dependent; and

2) a copy of such written statement is or has been furnished to the Insured, insured Dependent, or the Insured’s or any insured Dependent’s beneficiary or legal representative.

B If the statement relates to an Insured’s or any insured Dependent’s insurability, it will not be used to contest the validity of insurance which has been in force, before the contest, for two (2) years from t he date of issue.
deferredefftermcont:
In addition to our standard continuation allowances (maximum of 12 months for illness or injury and 1 month for temporary lay-off or approved leave of absence), Minnesota requires up to an 18-month continuation period in certain circumstances. The following (Certificate) text describes the continuation: 
‘’…but not longer than:…
(3) eighteen (18 months, or until you obtain coverage under another group policy, whichever is less, if due to your termination or lay-off from employment and insurance under the Policy remains in force for any active employee of Participating Unit. After such (18) month period you may convert your coverage under the Policy to an individual life insurance policy, without further proof of good health. The conversion will be subject to the terms and conditions set forth under the Conversion Privilege, except the individual policy will provide the same substantially similar benefits as those provided under the Policy.
(a) You are considered to be laid-off if you are no longer a Full-time employee as defined in the Policy. Termination does not include discharge for gross misconduct.
The Participating Unit must send a notice of continuation of insurance to you by first class certified mail to your last known address. You may elect the continuation of insurance within a sixty (60) day period. Such sixty (60) day period will begin on the date the insurance coverage would otherwise terminate or on the date notice is received, whichever is later.’’
converpriv:
1) Our standard conversion offer specifically excludes a term life insurance product from availability as a conversion policy. Although the Minnesota version of the Certificate’s Conversion Privilege provision does not contain wording to specifically exclude a term policy from being an available conversion product, administratively we do not allow conversion to a term life insurance policy.
Our standard conversion offer contains specific conversion rules when insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy or termination of the Participating Unit. Since Minnesota does not permit these different rules, the rules found in item B (1) and (2) have been removed, as well as any references to item B in the text. This action does not change the fact that conversion is still available in the event of termination or amendment of the Policy or termination of the Participating Unit.
portability:
Our standard Portability form is the revised form (i.e., -0299 extension). Since the revised form was not approved in Minnesota, the only Portability provision on file for Minnesota is the original (i.e., -1188 extension).
This means that in Minnesota:
a) portability is also available when coverage terminates because the Participating Unit terminates; and
the premium rates charged to Insureds who choose to continue coverage under the Portability provision are the standard case rates applicable to the employer group (i.e., we do not charge the ‘’portation’’ rates).
settleopt:
1) In addition to our standard benefit payment options (single-sum payment and 3 alternate settlement options), Minnesota requires a 4th option. The additional option is as follows:

OPTION D – LIFE ANNUITY OPTION

An Annuity will be payable during the lifetime of the Beneficiary, ceasing with the last payment due prior to the death of the Beneficiary.

2) A detailed description of all settlement options has been added to the Certificate.
depinsurance:
1) Our standard conversion offer specifically excludes a term life insurance product from availability as a conversion policy. Although the Minnesota version of the Certificate’s Conversion of Dependent Life Insurance section does not contain wording to specifically exclude a term policy from being an available conversion product, administratively we do not allow conversion to a term life insurance policy.
2) Our standard conversion offer contains specific conversion rules when insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy or termination of the Participating Unit. Since Minnesota does not permit these different rules, the rules found in item B (1) and (2) have been removed, as well as any references to item B in the form. This action does not change the fact that conversion is still available in the event of termination or amendment of the Policy or termination of the Participating Unit.
adanddbene:
The EXCEPTIONS section has been changed as follows:
a) Our standard ‘’felony exclusion’’ has been changed by removal of the words ‘’an assault or’’ from the text, so that the exclusion now reads: ‘’your commission or attempted commission of a felony;’’.
b) The alcohol intoxication exclusion has been removed.
claimsprovis: Minnesota requires a maximum of 5 years (not 3 years) in which to bring legal action.
accbenerider:
1) This Rider is titled ‘’Accelerated Benefit Rider’’ 
 (not ‘’Living Benefit Rider’’).
2) The Rider’s heading has been revised to read as 
 follows:
THIS RIDER ADDS AN ACCELERATED BENEFIT PROVISION TO THE GROUP LIFE PLAN. THE INSURED MAY ELECT TO TAKE THIS ACCELERATION UNDER THE CONDITIONS DESCRIBED IN THIS RIDER. THIS RIDER DOES NOT PROVIDE LONG-TERM CARE COVERAGE MEETING THE REQUIREMENTS OF MINNESOTA STATUTES SECTION 62A.46 TO 62a.56 OR CHAPTER 62S. RECEIPT OF THIS ACCELERATED BENEFIT WILL REDUCE THE DEATH BENEFIT. INSUREDS SHOULD SEEK ASSISTANCE FROM THEIR OPERSONAL TAX ADVISOR.
3) Minnesota imposes a benefit requirement that the insured be certified a terminally Ill prior to age 65.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association* Notice (LRS-8665-0412): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the Minnesota Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

facepage: Our address (Philadelphia address) appears within the masthead on both the Group Policy and Certificate.
converpriv: The minimum conversion amount is $10,000 (not $5,000) if insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy, or the termination of the Participating Unit.
facilitypaymentlimitat:
Missouri permits denial of a claim for death by suicide only when we can show that the insured intended suicide at the time of application for the coverage. The 1st paragraph of the LIMITATIONS section (Certificate) has been changed to read as follows:

‘’If an Insured or insured Dependent (s) dies by suicide, while sane or insane, within one (1) year from the Effective Date of his/her insurance coverage, our payment will be limited to a refund of all premiums paid for such coverage of such insured prior to his date of death.’’
vgwaiverofprem:
Our Waiver of Premium provision provides that we will waive premium and extend insurance during a period of Total Disability if, among other requirements, the Total Disability lasts for at least 6 months and the premiums continue to be paid during the 6 month period. Missouri requires that we express the ‘’6 months’’ in terms of days, so that the above noted requirements now reads (certificate):

‘’…(2) the Total Disability lasts for at least one hundred eighty (180) days in a row;…’’

…(4) the premium continues to be paid during the one hundred eighty (180) day period.’’

Missouri requires that we define ‘’Total Disability/Totally Disabled’’ as follows (certificate):

‘’Total Disability/Totally Disabled’’ means: an employee’s inability to perform the material and substantial duties of any occupation for which he is suited by means of education, training or experience.’’
adanddbene:
The EXCEPTIONS section has been changed as follows (certificate):

‘’…(3) sickness or disease which contributes to the Loss (except pyogenic infections which result from an accidental bodily injury or bacterial infections which result from the accidental ingestion of contaminated substances); or’’…
claimsprovis: Form prints only when the VG AD&D Benefit is on the plan.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8475-1216): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the Missouri Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

converpriv:
1. Item A. (1) is replaced with the following:  (1) the policy may be any life plan we currently issue, except term insurance.  It will be the standard type issued by us for the age and amount applied for; 

2. Item B is replaced with the following: B. if the insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of this Policy or termination of the Participating Unit, an Individual life insurance policy may be issued.  An insured must have been insured for at least three (3) YEARS UNDER THIS Policy.  The same rule as in A. above will apply, except that the face amount will be the lesser of:  (1) The Amount of Insurance the Insured had under this Policy immediately before his insurance terminated.  This amount will be less any amount he is entitled to under any other group life policy issued by us or another insurance company; or (2) $10,000.
depinsurance: Under Conversion of Dependent Life Insurance, item B. is replaced with the following:  B. If the insurance of an insured Dependent ceases due to the termination or amendment of this Policy or termination of the Participating Unit, then he may convert his insurance to an individual policy.  The Dependent must have been insured for at least three (3) years under this Policy.  The same rules as in A. above will apply, except that the face amount will be the lesser of: (1) The amount of Dependent life insurance under this policy.  This amount will be less any amount of group life insurance the Dependent receives or becomes eligible for within thirty-one (31) days after this policy terminates; or (2) $10,000.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8841-0711): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief  explanation of the Montana Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

genprovis:
The Policy Termination provisions is replaced with the following:  You may cancel this Policy at any time by providing us with written notice.  This Policy will be cancelled on the date we receive your letter or, if later, the date requested in your letter.  We may cancel this Policy if:  (1) the premium is not paid at the end of the Grace period; or (2) the number of Insureds is less than the minimum Participation requirements on the Participating Unit Application; or (3) the percentage of eligible persons insured is less than the Minimum Participation Requirements on the Participating Unit Application.  
If we cancel because of (1) above, this policy will be cancelled at the end of the Grace Period.  If we cancel because of (2) or (3) above, we will give you sixty (60) days written notice prior to the date of cancellation.  You will still owe us any premium that is not paid up to the date this Policy is cancelled.  We will return, pro-rata, any part of the premium paid beyond the date this policy is cancelled.
premiums: The last sentence is replaced with the following:  We will notify the Participating Unit and/or the employee in writing at least sixty (60) days before a premium change is made due to (10 above.
tablerenewalprem: The fourth paragraph is replaced with the following:  We reserve the right to change the rates.  The change will be determined upon the experience for the class of risk insured under the Policy.  We will give written notice of our intention to change such rates at least sixty (60) days prior to any Policy anniversary date.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8696-1013): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the Nevada Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

particunitapp:
1) New Hampshire requires coverage of dependents, regardless of age, who are mentally or physically incapable of earning a living remain financially dependent on the employee for support. When Dependent Life Insurance is of the plan, the following text is automatically included in the Policy’s Participating Unit Application and in the Certificate’s Dependent Life Insurance section (Participating Unit Application text is presented below):
Dependent means:…
… (d) the employee’s legal spouse or child(ren) who is mentally or physically incapable of earning a living and remains financially dependent on the employee for support, provided due proof of such incapacity is received by us within thirty-one (31) days of the date such Dependent reaches the maximum age, and annually thereafter.
2) New Hampshire is a mandatory Civil Union state. When Dependent Life Insurance is on the plan, the following civil union/domestic partner text is automatically included in t he Policy’s Participating Unit Application and in the Certificate’s Dependent Life Insurance section (Participating Unit Application text  is presented below):
‘’Dependent means:…
…Additionally, with respect to an employee who is a partner in a civil union (as defined by New Hampshire law) or for whom an Affidavit of Domestic Partnership is on file with the Participating Unit and is in effect, such employee’s 
(a) civil union partner or domestic partner; and
(b) children, provided he/she otherwise meets the definition of Dependent of the civil union or as named on an Affidavit will be considered a ‘’Dependent’’ of such employee. 
When the employee’s civil union partner or domestic partner is covered under the Policy, the word ‘’spouse’’ as it appears in the Policy will be deemed to mean ‘’civil union partner’’ or ‘’domestic partner’’, unless the context indicates otherwise.
continslabordisp: New Hampshire law requires the Continuation of Insurance During labor Dispute.
converpriv:
1) The minimum conversion amount of $10,000 (not $5,000) if insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy, or the termination of the Participating Unit.
2) New Hampshire law requires the following item be added to the Conversion Privilege section (see item H.):
H. You must be given written notice of your right to convert to an individual policy within fifteen (15) days after the date your insurance terminates. If this notice is given more than fifteen (15) days following the date of such termination, the time allowed for conversion will be extended for a period of fifteen (15) days following the date written notice was given.
facilitypaymentlimitat: When there is no named Beneficiary or the named beneficiary is not surviving at the insured’s death, we may pay up to $250 (not $2,500) to a person who has incurred expenses in connection with the insured’s last illness, death or burial.
depinsurance:
1) New Hampshire requires coverage Dependents, regardless of age, who are mentally or physically incapable of earning a living and remain financially dependent on the employee for support. When Dependent Life Insurance is on the plan, the following text is automatically included in the Certificate’s Dependent Life Insurance section (see introductory paragraphs section).
Dependent means:…
… (d) your legal spouse or child(ren) who are mentally or physically incapable of earning a living and remains financially dependent on you for support, provided due proof of such incapacity is received by us within thirty-one (31) days of the date such Dependent reaches the maximum age, and annually thereafter.
2) New Hampshire is a mandatory Civil Union state. When Dependent Life Insurance is on the plan, the following text is automatically included in the Certificate’s Dependent Life Insurance section (see introductory paragraphs section).
‘’Dependent means:…
…Additionally, with respect to an employee who is a partner in a civil union (as defined by New Hampshire law) or for whom an Affidavit of Domestic Partnership is on file with the Participating Unit and is in effect, such employee’s 
(c) civil union partner or domestic partner; and
(d) children, provided he/she otherwise meets the definition of Dependent,
of the civil union or as named on an Affidavit will be considered your ‘’Dependent’’. When your civil union partner or domestic partner is covered under the Policy, the word ‘’spouse’’ as it appears in the Policy will be deemed to mean ‘’civil union partner’’ or ‘’domestic partner’’, unless the context indicates otherwise.
3) in the CONVERSION OF DEPENDENT LIFE INSURANCE section, the minimum conversion amount is $10,000 (not $5,000) if insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy, or the termination of the Participating Unit.
4) New Hampshire law requires the following be added to the Conversion Privilege section (Certificate text; see closing paragraphs section):
The insured Dependent must be given written notice of his right to convert to an individual policy within fifteen (15) days after the date his insurance terminates. If this notice is given more than fifteen (15) days following the date of such termination, the time allowed for conversion will be extended for a period of fifteen (15) days following the date written notice was given.
requirednotices:
Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8920-0915): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief  
     explanation of the New Hampshire Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its  
     purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8727-1192): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the New Jersey Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

masterapp: New Mexico does not allow household resident, full-time student, and financially dependent as conditions for eligibility for dependent coverage.
scheduleofbeneandprem: New Mexico does not allow household resident, full-time student, and financially dependent as conditions for eligibility for dependent coverage.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-9490-1212): This form is attached to the certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the New Mexico Life Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

facepage:
New York requires the following statement on the Policy Face Page and the Certificate Face Page: 

Nothing in this (Cert = the) Policy will invalidate or impair the rights granted by the (Cert = this) Certificate of Insurance or by law to persons insured hereunder.

New York Requires the following Statement on the Policy Face Page and the Certificate Face page.  The statement will appear in red whenever the Extension of Coverage Under the Unformed Services Employment And Reemployment Rights Act (USERRA) provision is included in the coverage:  

READ YOUR POLICY CAREFULLY. CERTAIN WAR RISKS ARE NOT ASSUMED. 
IN CASE OF ANY DOUBT, WRITE YOUR COMPANY FOR FURTHER EXPLANATION.
vgapplication:
New York requires the following Fraud Notice on the Policy Application (note that the notice pertains to health insurance only – i.e., the VG AD&D Benefit) and is coded not to print when the VG AD&D Benefit is not on the plan:

This fraud warning notice applies only to this Policy’s Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance benefit:

Any person who knowingly and with intent to defraud any insurance company or other person files an application for insurance or statement of claim containing any materially false information or conceals, for the purpose of misleading, information concerning any fact material thereto, commits a fraudulent insurance act, which is a crime, and shall be subject to a civil penalty not to exceed $5,000 and the stated value of the claim for each violation.
scheduleofcoverage: Note there is no generic Schedule – the NY DOI would not permit it.
scheduleofbeneandprem:
1) Children are covered from ‘’birth’’
2) Dependent does not include any foster children
3) The NY VG benefit amount schedule consists of the following: 

$10,000; $20,000; $30,000; $40,000; $50,000: $100,000: $150,000; $200,000; $250,000; $300,000; $350,000; $400,000; $450,000; $500,000 

$10,000 - $50,000 in $10,000 increments

4) As of mid-November, 2010, spouse GI is available in NY
5) NY VG imposes a maximum age of 75 for employees. Termination at age 75 is applicable only to employees whose VG coverage is being continued under the Portability provision
       Employees who are Actively-at-Work and       
       work the required minimum number of   
       hours for full time or part-time employees 
       are not subject to this age cap.

6) The NY VG has three non-variable ADEA reduction schedule applicable to employees:
Attained Age      Amount of Insurance
76-79 60% of available or in force amount
80-84               40% of available or in force amount
85-89 25% of available or in force amount
90-94               15% of available or in force amount
95 and over        10% of available or in force amount

Attained Age      Amount of Insurance
76-79                  60% of available or in force amount
80-84                  40% of available or in force amount
85-89                  25% of available or in force amount
90-94                  15% of available or in force amount
95 and over        10% of available or in force amount

Attained Age      Amount of Insurance
75-79                  60% of available or in force amount
80-84                  35% of available or in force amount
85-89                27.5% of available or in force amount
90-94                  20% of available or in force amount
95-99                  7.5% of available or in force amount
100 and over      5% of available or in force amount
genprovis:
Entire Contract, second paragraph revised to the following:  Your rights and the rights of any Insured, insured Dependent or Beneficiary shall be affected only by provisions contained in this Policy, riders, endorsements, or amendments signed by you and us, in the Policy Application attached to this Policy, or in any individual statements, if any, submitted in connection therewith.

Incontestability paragraph revised to the following:  Any statements made by you or by any Insured, or any insured Dependent, under this Policy, will be deemed a representation, not a warranty.  We cannot contest this Policy after it has been in force for two (20 years, except for non-payment of premiums.  No statement made by any Insured or any insured Dependent under this policy relating to his/her insurability shall be used in contesting the validity of insurance with respect to which such statement was made after such insurance has been in force prior to the contest for a period of two (2) years during such Insured’s or any insured Dependent’s lifetime and in no event unless it is in a written instrument signed by him/her, a copy of which is or has been furnished to such person or to his/her beneficiary or legal representative.

Policy Termination revised to the following:  paragraph removed stating we may terminate this Policy at any time after 12 months from its effective date.
newbornchild: This is a NY VG-only provision, required because child coverage in NY is ‘’from birth’’. Per this provision, the newborn automatically becomes an insured at the moment of live birth. If at the moment of live birth, the employee does not already have Dep child coverage under the VG plan, the newborn remains an insured person until 31 days of age. The newborn then ceases to be insured unless the employee submits written application for Dep children coverage within the 31-day period and pays the applicable premium when due.
portability:
(1) Insurance coverage can be converted at any time while coverage is continued under the Portability provision.
       (2)  The provision includes a NOTICE OF   
             PORTABILITY RIGHT and LIMITED TIME 
             PERIOD TO EXERCISE PORTABILITY 
             section that sets forth the Policyholder’s 
             responsibility regarding notification and the 
             employee’s responsibilities regarding 
             exercising Portability.
ownerbeneficassign:
(1) The BENEFICIARY section represents an extensive rewrite compared to RSL VG.
(2) Note that the provision does not allow for either the Policyholder or a company officer in that capacity to be the beneficiary.
(3) Successive beneficiary language is included.

facepage:
North Carolina requires the following statement on the certificate face page:
THE GROUP MASTER POLICY PROVIDING YOUR COVERAGE IS GOVERNED PRIMARILY BY THE LAWS OF A STATE OTHER THAN NORTH CAROLINA.
genprovis: North Carolina only allows Misstatement of Age.  Cannot use Misstatement of Smoking or Tobacco status.
facilitypaymentlimitat: When there is no named Beneficiary or the named Beneficiary is not surviving at the insured’s death, we may pay up to $250 (not $2,000) to a person who has incurred expenses in connection with the insured’s last illness, death or burial.
claimsprovis: Proof of loss must be sent to us within 180 days.
livingbenerider: The insured is eligible to exercise the Living Benefit option after having been insured under the Rider for at least 30 days (not 60 days) for sickness and at any time for accident (see the DESCRIPTION OF COVERAGE section).
requirednotices:
Information Notice*: This form is attached to the Policy. It sets forth the fiduciary responsibilities of the entity responsible for the payment of group life insurance premiums.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8697-0114): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the North Carolina Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

genprovis:
Clerical Error provision is replaced with the following:  Clerical errors in connection with this policy or delays in keeping records for this Policy, whether by you, us, the participating Unit or the plan administrator:

(1) will not terminate insurance that would otherwise have been effective; and

(2) will not continue insurance that would otherwise have ceased or should not have been in effect.

Clerical Errors include (but are not limited to) the payment of premium for coverage not provided by this Policy.  If appropriate, a fair adjustment of premium will be made to correct a clerical error.
converpriv: If the dollar amount in item B. (2) is an amount other than $10,000, then said dollar amount is changed to $10,000.
facilitypaymentlimitat: Under the section, Limitations, the first paragraph is deleted and replaced with the following:  If an Insured or insured Dependent(s) dies by suicide while sane or insane, within one (1) year from the effective date of his insurance coverage, our payment will be limited to a refund of all premiums paid prior to the date of death.
depinsurance: Under Conversion of Dependent Life Insurance:  If the dollar amount in item B. (2) is an amount other than $10,000, then said dollar amount is changed to $10,000.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8611-0712): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the North Dakota Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

accbenerider:
Must be titled Accelerated Death Benefit; Terminal Illness is 24 months; T-bill language for computation of back-end loads; no elimination; Disclosure Form (LRS-8596-004-1298-OH) must be contained as part of the certificate.
Lump Sum option must be offered; a statement that this benefit does not provide Long Term Care Coverage; a statement that Accidental Death Benefit is not affected by payment of Accelerated Death Benefit; a statement that payment of the Accelerated Death Benefit is due immediately upon receipt of written proof of eligibility; a statement that the form shall be incontestable on the same or more favorable basis as the underlying policy.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8622-0316): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the Ohio Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8563-1110):  This notice must be attached to the certificate(s).  It discloses the purposes and limitations of the Oklahoma Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-9219 Ed. 0110): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the Rhode Island Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

converpriv: The minimum conversion amount is $10,000 (not $5,000) if insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy, or the termination of the Participating Unit.
depinsurance: In the CONVERSION OF DEPENDENT LIFE INSURANCE section, the minimum conversion amount is $10,000 (not $5,000) if insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy, or the termination of the Participating Unit.

genprovis: Misstatement of Age is allowed.  South Dakota does not allow use of Smoking or Tobacco Status.
converpriv: South Dakota does not permit a minimum conversion amount when insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy, or the termination of the Policyholder. Item (2) was deleted from Section B in the Conversion Privilege.
depinsurance: South Dakota does not permit a minimum conversion amount when insurance ceases due to the termination or amendment of the Policy, or the termination of the Policyholder. Accordingly, Item (2) was deleted from Section B in the CONVERSION OF DEPENDENT LIFE INSURANCE provision in the DEPENDENT LIFE INSURANCE section.
requirednotices:
Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8571-0513):  The ‘’Notice Concerning Coverage Limitations and    
Exclusions Under the South Dakota Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Act’’ must be attached to the   Certificate(s).

Information Notice (LRS-8464-1192): This form is attached the Certificate. It provides the name, address, and telephone number of the field office providing service to the Participating Unit.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8580-0410): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the Tennessee Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8785-0914):  The 'Important Information about Coverage Under the   
Texas Life, Accident, Health and Hospital Service Insurance Guaranty Association' notice must be  attached to the certificate(s).

Complaint Notice (LRS-8690-0317): This bilingual notice provides information on how to make an inquiry to the Company or a complaint to the Department.  It must be attached to the front of the policy and certificate(s).

claimsprovis:
Proof of Loss provision is replaced with the following: For any covered loss, written proof must be sent to us within (90) days.  If written proof is not given within that time, the claim will not be reduced by or invalidated if it is shown proof was given as soon as reasonably possible.  In any event, unless delayed by the claimant’s legal incapacity, the required proof must be given within one (1) year of the date of the covered loss.

Fiduciary paragraph has been removed.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8729-0710): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief  explanation of the Utah Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

portability: Portability is not available in Vermont
extensionofcoveragefmla: FMLA/USERRA is not available in Vermont
vgvermontriders:
Under Policy Definitions, the Age of the Insured is replaced with the following:  The Issue Age of the Insured is the Insured’s age last birthday on the Anniversary Date (shown in the Schedule of Benefits and Premiums) in the year his coverage begins.
The Ages provision in the Rider is deleted and replaced by the following:  The Issue Age of the Insured Dependent spouse is the spouse’s age last birthday on the Anniversary Date in the year his coverage begins.  The Issue Age of an Insured Dependent child is the child’s age last birthday on the Anniversary Date in the year his coverage begins.  The Anniversary Date is shown in the Schedule of Benefits and Premiums.
The following is added to the definition of Insured Dependent:  For an Insured who has an Affidavit of Domestic Partnership on file with the Participant, 'Insured Dependent' will include (a) an Insured’s domestic partner; and (b) such domestic partner’s eligible child(ren), provided they otherwise meet the definition of Insured Dependent.  When the Insured’s domestic partner is covered for Dependent Life Insurance, the word 'spouse' will be deemed to mean 'domestic partner' wherever it may appear, unless the context indicates otherwise.
additionalnotes: Please note:  There are no form numbers for the Voluntary Term Life Insurance Agreement. Vermont is an Individual State which means the insured (employee) is the owner of the policy. The employer receives the agreement and the employee receives the policy.

requirednotices:
Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-9452-0115): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides   a brief explanation of the Virginia, Accident and Sickness Insurance Guaranty Association Act,  including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

Beneficiary Designation Notice: LRS-9080-0600.  

Important Information Notice: LRS-8426-0593.

masterapp: Washington requires that all applications for insurance must contain the following statement (or one substantially similar): ‘’It is a crime to knowingly provide false, incomplete or misleading information to an insurance company for the purpose of defrauding the company. Penalties may include imprisonment, fines or a denial of insurance benefits.’’
accbenerider: Must be titled Accelerated Benefit; special disclaimer on rider face page; maximum elimination period 0 days for accident and 30 days for sickness; Disclosure must be part of certificate. Arbitration language need. T-bill language for computation of back-end loads; Terminal Illness is 24 months.

It provides a brief explanation of the West Virginia Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8645-0315): This form is attached to the Certificate. It provides a brief explanation of the Wyoming Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, including its purpose and scope; the coverage it provides; and its limitations and exclusions.
